condemn.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong
condemn.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
The law has been condemned as an attack on personal liberty.
She knew that society would condemn her for leaving her children.
condemn.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to give someone a severe punishment after deciding they are guilty of a crime
condemn.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
condemn.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if a particular situation condemns someone to something, it forces them to live in an unpleasant way or to do something unpleasant
condemn.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: people condemned to a life of poverty
His occupation condemned him to spend long periods of time away from his family.
condemn.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to state officially that something is not safe enough to be used
condemn.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: an old house that had been condemned
The pool was closed after being condemned as a health hazard.
